DataElement.preferredName: DNA Copy Number Programming Parameter Smoothing Standard Deviation Scale java.lang.Double
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.:The number of molecules of a particular type on or in a cell or part of a cell. Usually applied to specific genes or to plasmids within a bacterium.:A value that is passed to a routine._The modification of a set of data to make it smooth and nearly continuous and remove or diminish outlying points.:A measure of the range of values in a set of numbers. Standard deviation is a statistic used as a measure of the dispersion or variation in a distribution, equal to the square root of the arithmetic mean of the squares of the deviations from the arithmetic mean.:An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes._Generic value domain for a primitive java datatype that is a Double-precision floating point number (64-bit IEEE 7540).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.:The number of molecules of a particular type on or in a cell or part of a cell. Concepts.definition: A long linear double-stranded polymer formed from nucleotides attached to a deoxyribose backbone and found in the nucleus of a cell; associated with the transmission of genetic information.
The number of molecules of a particular type on or in a cell or part of a cell. Usually applied to specific genes or to plasmids within a bacterium.
A value that is passed to a routine.

Property.preferredDefinition: The modification of a set of data to make it smooth and nearly continuous and remove or diminish outlying points.:A measure of the range of values in a set of numbers. Standard deviation is a statistic used as a measure of the dispersion or variation in a distribution, equal to the square root of the arithmetic mean of the squares of the deviations from the arithmetic mean.:An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

Concepts.definition: The process by which a data set is simplified to reduce irregularities.

A measure of the range of values in a set of numbers. Standard deviation is a statistic used as a measure of the dispersion or variation in a distribution, equal to the square root of the arithmetic mean of the squares of the deviations from the arithmetic mean.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/27/11 Released GenePattern-GISTIC v1.0 content per Ted Liefeld as part of model cleanup task.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Generic value domain for a primitive java datatype that is a Double-precision floating point number (64-bit IEEE 7540).

ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from DRAFT NEW to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
